1.text: Take the Brussels sprouts off the stalk.

2.text: Soak the Brussels sprouts in warm water for 10 minutes.

3.text: Rinse the Brussels sprouts with fresh water and then pat them dry.

4.text: Place the Brussels sprouts in resealable plastic freezer bags.

5.text: Write the date on each bag with permanent marker.

6.text: Store the bags of Brussels sprouts in the freezer for up to 12 months.

7.text: Boil a pot of water and separate the Brussels sprouts by size.

8.text: Prepare a large bowl of ice water.

9.text: Boil your small Brussels sprouts for 3 minutes.

10.text: Transfer the small Brussels sprouts from the boiling water to the bowl of ice.

11.text: Take the Brussels sprouts out of the ice water and pat them dry with a dishcloth.

12.text: Repeat with the other Brussels sprouts, but use longer boiling times.

13.text: Place the blanched Brussels sprouts in resealable plastic freezer bags.

14.text: Write the date on the bags in permanent marker.

15.text: Keep the Brussels sprouts in the freezer for up to 12 months.
